intro: Lepidagathis incurva var. mollis, commonly known as the soft-leaved lepidagathis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. Native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia, this plant thrives in humid, warm climates. It is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks, where it forms dense mats. The plant's unique morphology and ecological adaptability make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
